narratives.question_text: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload
comments: I appreciated having something due every week that pushed us to engage with that week's class material. The work always seemed reasonable and relevant to the topic at hand.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
comments: The course was very organized, which allowed for greater learning to occur.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
comments: Greg is a caring and thorough instructor, and I appreciated the mix of lecture and discussion during class time. He was always highly responsive to us outside of class as well, and I particularly appreciated the quick and useful feedback that he crafted for every assignment that we submitted.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on: Visitors, if any
comments: I appreciated when Michael Ross visited class. Perhaps adding a guest who is a Board member would be useful to hear more about governance from his/her perspective.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
comments: I learned a great deal, particularly from our class discussions, which pushed my thinking. I think it's particularly helpful to take Governance after having been on fellowship and experienced board operations first-hand.

As mentioned above, I think adding in more from the perspective of Board members would be helpful for us to understand these topics from different angles. The 4 minute time constraint for the final presentations seemed quite unrealistic and didn't allow for thorough presentations or discussions. I would recommend planning for at least 10 minutes per student, so that there isn't a rush at the end. Or perhaps plan to spread the presentations out over the course of two class meetings.
